data.title: Sarah Carver, Marriage, Family, Genealogy, 25 April 1888, Clermont County, Ohio
data.text:
Janet and Robert Wolfe Genealogy --- Go to Genealogy Page for Harry E Kennedy --- Go to Genealogy Page for Sarah Carver

Notes for Harry E Kennedy and Sarah Carver

1870 Sarah A Carver (age 7, born in Ohio) lived in Franklin Twp, Clermont County, Ohio, in a household with Larut W Carver (age 49), Rebecca Carver (age 41), Florence Carver (age 13), Lucy A Carver (age 11), Francis Carver (age 9), and Stella E Carver (age 4). Sarah A Carver was at school. [1]

1880 Sarah A. C. (age 17, born in Ohio, single), daughter, lived in Felicity Twp, Clermont County, Ohio, in a household with W. C. (age 59), Florence C. (age 24), Lucy A. C. (age 21), Fanny M. C. (age 19), Stella E. C. (age 14), and Geo. D. C. (age 11). Sarah A. C.'s parents were both born in Ohio. Sarah A. C. was a music teacher. [2]

1888 Harry E. Kennedy and Sarah A. Carver were married on April 25, 1888 in Clermont County, Ohio. [3] [4]

1888 In the June term of the Clermont County court, Sarah Carver Kennedy, Fannie Carver, Estella Carver, Lucy Carver, and George A Carver were listed among several plaintiffs, regarding the estate of [their grand-father] John Page. [5]

1900 Sarah Kennedy (born in Ohio in Nov 1862, married for 12 years), wife, lived in Cincinnati Ward 31, Hamilton County, Ohio, in a household with Harry E Kennedy (age 36). Sarah Kennedy's parents were both born in Ohio. Sarah Kennedy had had no children. [6] [7]

1908 Sarah A. Carver Kennedy was buried at Felicity Cemetery, Felicity, Clermont County, Ohio. Sarah A. Carver Kennedy was born in 1862. No monument shown. [8] [9]

1910 Harry E Kennedy (age 48, born in Canada, married for 4 years) lived in Cincinnati Ward 2, Hamilton County, Ohio, in a household with Margaret F Kennedy (age 36). Harry E Kennedy's parents were both born in England. Harry E Kennedy could read and write. Harry E Kennedy was a architect. [10]

Obituary for Harry Edward Kennedy

The Cincinnati Enquirer, Cincinnati, Ohio, August 17, 1924. [11] [12]

Footnotes:

[2] United States Federal Census, 1880, [AncestryImage], [AncestryRecord].
